H0.text: Goosebumps happen when mammals raise their hair with tiny muscles in the skin.

H1.text: Bleeding occurs when mammals raise their hair with tiny muscles in the skin.

H2.text: Balding occurs when mammals raise their hair with tiny muscles in the skin.

H3.text: Bruising occurs when mammals raise their hair with tiny muscles in the skin.

A4.text: Contraction of these muscles causes the hairs to stand on end, known colloquially as goose bumps (piloerection).

A5.text: Inducing contraction of the arrector pili muscles via an Î±1-adrenergic receptor agonist has been shown to reduce hair shedding as a result of traction alopecia.
